title: Vikings season 6 episode 1 kicks off with bumper two-hour episode
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The release date for Vikings season six has finally been confirmed so fans can prepare to say goodbye to their beloved historical drama.

The first episode of the final chapter will air on the History Channel on Wednesday 4 December and viewers will be treated to an extra special two-hour installment.

Addressing his 2.2million followers on Instagram, Alexander Ludwig revealed: ‘Vikings is back and more intense than ever premiering for two hours on December 4th 9/8c on @historytv@historyvikings.

‘I hope you are all as excited as I am for the epic ending all our amazing fans deserve. But before that..it gets insane…. so much love to you all.’

The star, who plays Björn Ironside in the series, added: ‘I really can’t believe we have managed to end the show the way we hoped we would when we started. It is all because of you! Enjoy!’

The first episode of season six will be two-hours (Picture: History Channel)

The trailer for the last season of Vikings dropped earlier this week and it looks like we’re in for one hell of a ride.

Alexander teased high drama on the way, writing to his fans: ‘The finale season begins December 4th! WHOS READY FOR THE INSANITY?!’.

Meanwhile, Alexander’s co-stars Katheryn Winnick and Alex Høgh Andersen have teased their favourite scenes from the upcoming season, which includes an ‘epic’ battle.

Katheryn, who plays Lagertha, said: ‘I guess my most memorable battle has to be Lagertha’s next battle in season six.

‘It is epic, took weeks to rehearse, lots of blood, sweat and tears.

‘It is definitely going to be something you have never seen before.’

Alex added: ‘My favourite battle scene when shooting Vikings is from an episode called Homeland.

‘My character, Ivar The Boneless, is charging into battle, and he’s really eager to get there, and yet when he finally arrives he gets knocked off the chariot.

‘Straight away he finds himself all along on the battlefield, facing a hundred Saxon soldiers.’

Vikings returns Wednesday 4th December at 9/8c on the History Channel.
